title: Do we need more regional students studying medicine? | ABC NEWS
description: Australia's facing a GP shortage, with the regions being the hardest hit. Could attracting more rural students to medical degrees help solve the problem?  Reporting by Amal Wehbe, ABC News Social Media Team.  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Flooding, heavy rain and damaging winds hit north Queensland | ABC NEWS
description: Two severe weather warnings are in place in north Queensland as floodwaters cut off roads. Parts of north-west Queensland have recorded close to their annual average rainfall in one week. The Bureau of Meteorology said the tropical low causing the severe weather should start to weaken and move south from Wednesday.  Social video by David Douglas Stuart for the ABC News Social Media Team.   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: All indicators are pointing to higher interest rates in 2026 | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: The next interest rate decision from the Reserve Bank of Australia isn't until February. There are fears it could lift rates, if not in February, then some time next year. Meanwhile, there were only minor movements on most global markets as we near the end of 2025. Daniel Ziffer explains. title: Flood waters rise in north Queensland with rural towns expected to be cut off | ABC NEWS
description: Floodwaters in Queensland's north-west are set to rise over the next two days after parts of the region saw nearly a year's worth of rain fall in just 24 hours. The weather bureau says conditions are slowly easing, but there is still a lot more rain to come, and communities aren't out of the woods yet. title: China encircles Taiwan with hundreds of warships and fighter jets | ABC NEWS
description: China has moved hundreds of its warships, fighter jets and soldiers to completely encircle Taiwan. Beijing says the live fire military drills are a warning to the West and a showcase of its capacity to cut off Taiwan. US President Donald Trump has shrugged off the show of force, but Taiwan fears it brings the two world powers closer to conflict. title: How scientists are trying to preserve the rhino ray species from extinction | ABC NEWS
description: A group of species known as rhino rays, which includes sawfish, are among the most threatened animals in the ocean, but the waters of the Northern Territory have become an important refuge.  The capital Darwin is also the base for a dedicated shark and ray research team working to protect them worldwide.   An Indonesian researcher has travelled to the territory to join the effort â€” and to learn how she can help save the species back home.  Tristan Hooft filed this report for ABC News Northern Territory.   Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Followed while covering Myanmar's first election since military overthrow | ABC NEWS
description: Men on bikes followed ABC NEWS Asia editor Karishma Vyas constantly while covering elections in Myanmar. Polls have closed on the first phase of voting in the country's first election since the military overthrew the democratically elected government in 2021. The election has been widely dismissed as a sham by governments and human rights activists. The final results are set to be announced in February after two more rounds of voting.  ðŸ“¸ via ABC News by Asia editor Karishma Vyas and camera operator Haidarr Jones  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: The search for the body of a man seen submerging in Darwin Harbour | ABC NEWS
description: The search for the body of a man that was spotted floating in Darwin harbour before vanishing over the weekend has expanded.  The operation now includes land, sea and air vessels, with police calling for help to solve the mystery of who the man is. Joseph Hathway-Wilson has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Concerns over rise in Islamaphobia after Bondi terror attack | ABC NEWS
description: The Australian National Imams Council has recorded an almost 200% increase in reported anti-Muslim hate since the Bondi Beach attack. Incidents include vandalism at Islamic institutions, online abuse, and physical intimidations. NSW Premier Chris Minns has condemned Islamophobic acts as "shameful", the state government renewing calls for unity. title: Sydney prepares for NYE fireworks with bolstered police presence | ABC NEWS
description: A record number of police officers will be on patrol in Sydney as the city prepares to celebrate New Year's Eve just weeks after the Bondi terror attack. Some officers will be carrying long-arm weapons. Authorities say there is no active or imminent threat to the public, but safety is the priority. title: Severe Tropical Cyclone Hayley crosses Western Australia's Kimberley coast | ABC NEWS
description: Residents in Western Australia's far north are sheltering in the midst of severe Tropical Cyclone Hayley, after it made landfall hours ahead of forecast. Nathan McIvor from the Djarindjin Aboriginal Corporation joined Manny Tsigas while weathering the storm at his house, which he says began to move as the conditions intensified.
